summary: The text describes a divine judgment on Jacob's pride that causes turmoil and an uprising of the Roman Empire. This leads to an anticipated woe upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, fearing Roman retribution unless a significant death occurs. This fear becomes reality during a Roman siege where a large gathering of unbelievers, confident in the city's fortifications especially during Passover, are confronted with destruction. The text reflects on the overwhelming influx into the city and subsequent capture and dispersal of survivors after a significant loss of life, resembling the Nile's overflowing waters.
